trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with FM: Systems | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with FM: Systems | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use FM: Systems with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use FM: Systems with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and FM:Systems.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and FM:Systems.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A FM:Systems single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A FM:Systems single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to FM:Systems will be able to single sign into the application at your FM:Systems company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to FM:Systems will be able to single sign into the application at your FM:Systems company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for FM:Systems
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for FM:Systems

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for FM:Systems.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for FM:Systems.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type FM:Systems.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type FM:Systems.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select FM:Systems, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select FM:Systems, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>FM: Systems</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>FM: Systems</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to FM:Systems with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to FM:Systems with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the FM:Systems application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the FM:Systems application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to FM:Systems page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to FM:Systems page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the FM:Systems Sign On URL textbox, type your FM:Systems Reply URL (e.g.: https://dpr.fmshosted.com/fminteract/ConsumerService2.aspx).
trans-unit.target: In the FM:Systems Sign On URL textbox, type your FM:Systems Reply URL (e.g.: https://dpr.fmshosted.com/fminteract/ConsumerService2.aspx).

trans-unit.source: You can get this value from your FM: Systems support team.
trans-unit.target: You can get this value from your FM: Systems support team.

trans-unit.source: Click Next
trans-unit.target: Click Next

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at FM:Systems page, to download your metadata, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at FM:Systems page, to download your metadata, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Submit the downloaded metadata file to your FM: Systems support team.
trans-unit.target: Submit the downloaded metadata file to your FM: Systems support team.

trans-unit.source: Your FM: Systems support team has to do the actual SSO configuration.
trans-unit.target: Your FM: Systems support team has to do the actual SSO configuration.

trans-unit.source: You will get a notification when SSO has been enabled for your subscription.
trans-unit.target: You will get a notification when SSO has been enabled for your subscription.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into FM:Systems, they must be provisioned into FM:Systems.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into FM:Systems, they must be provisioned into FM:Systems.

trans-unit.source: In the case of FM:Systems, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of FM:Systems, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: In a web browser window, log into your FM:Systems company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a web browser window, log into your FM:Systems company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to System Administration \> Manage Security \> Users \> User list.
trans-unit.target: Go to System Administration \> Manage Security \> Users \> User list.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>System Administration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>System Administration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Create new user.
trans-unit.target: Click Create new user.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create New User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create New User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Create User section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Create User section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Type the user name, the password and its confirmation, the email address and the employee ID of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision into the related textboxes.
trans-unit.target: Type the user name, the password and its confirmation, the email address and the employee ID of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision into the related textboxes.

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other FM:Systems user account creation tools or APIs provided by FM:Systems to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other FM:Systems user account creation tools or APIs provided by FM:Systems to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the FM:Systems **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the FM:Systems **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
